definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
a small hole not plugged will give you grief when it gets bigger (idiom)/a stitch in time saves nine
pinyin: xiao3 dong4 bu4 du3 , da4 dong4 chi1 ku3

definition: A small hole not plugged will make you suffer a big hole (idiom); a stitch in time saves nine
pinyin: xiao3 dong4 bu4 bu3 da4 dong4 chi1 ku3

sentences.english: The summer season to endure hardship, balsam pear is undoubtedly good choice of vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 夏季要吃苦，当季蔬菜苦瓜无疑是好选择。

sentences.english: Analogy bear hardships prevenient, enjoy after.
sentences.chinese: 比喻吃苦在先，享受在后。

sentences.english: Can Bear hardships and hard work, healthly and strong, could adapt aloft operation outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 吃苦耐劳，身体健硕，适应户外高空操作设备。

sentences.english: As long as they lived, exertions would not be necessary to her.
sentences.chinese: 只要他们活着，是不需要她吃苦的。

sentences.english: He is always first to bear hardship and last to live in ease and comfortbale.
sentences.chinese: “他总是吃苦在前享受在后”这样翻译对不？

sentences.english: Good communication, work hard and endure hardships, long-term work at.
sentences.chinese: 善于沟通，吃苦耐劳，能长期在项目现场工作。

sentences.english: Whenever we are having a hard time doing something, we should not be afraid to endure the pain.
sentences.chinese: 每当我们很难做某件事时，不应怕吃苦。

sentences.english: However, if we focus only on conservation, then people may suffer.
sentences.chinese: 然而，如果我们只关注保护，那人类就要吃苦头了。

sentences.english: In addition, but also agree to bear hardships.
Someone who doesn't observe traffic regulations will sweat.
sentences.chinese: 不遵守交通规则者必将要吃苦头。

sentences.english: Never toy with a woman's feelings, or it could be the worse for you!
sentences.chinese: 千万不要玩弄女人的感情，否则你会吃苦头的。

sentences.english: Zheng Wanyi sincerely look forward to her daughter in full bloom less hardship, get married soon.
sentences.chinese: 郑婉颐真心盼着女儿盛开少吃苦，早日嫁出去。
煤矿工人都是能吃苦耐劳的。

sentences.english: John picked a fight with Jack and came off worst.
sentences.chinese: 约翰寻衅和杰克打架，结果大吃苦头。

sentences.english: Don't punish yourself by swallowing the “no pain, no gain” philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 不必用“一分耕耘，一分收获”的想法让自己吃苦。

sentences.english: He's always the first to bear hardships.

definition: to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
to endure/to suffer/hardships/torments/a hard time/a nuisance
shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows/for better or for worse
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
one cannot achieve glory and wealth without having been through trials and tribulations (proverb)/no pain, no gain
pinyin: chi1 de2 ku3 zhong1 ku3 , fang1 wei2 ren2 shang4 ren2
related.word: 吃得苦中苦，方为人上人

definition: exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
